snippet: The comments by the Russian lawmaker, Aleksei Pushkov, seemed to reflect the Kremlin’s increasing desire to be rid of Edward J. Snowden.
abstract: Senior Russian Parliament member Aleksei Pushkov says political asylum in Venezuela would be 'best solution' for former intelligence contractor Edward J Snowden, indicating that while Russia still has no intention of turning Snowden over to United States or impeding his travel to any other country, it would like to be rid of him; Snowden faces logistical nightmare in arranging travel from Moscow airport to Latin America.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Moscow, and Randal C. Archibold from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The comments by the Russian lawmaker, Aleksei Pushkov, seemed to reflect the Kremlin’s increasing desire to be rid of Edward J. Snowden.

headline.main: Russian Official Says Venezuela Is the ‘Best Solution’ for Snowden
headline.print_headline: Russian Official Says Venezuela Is the ‘Best Solution’ for Snowden
